questions.question_text:
A VMware vSphere 6.x Administrator is tasked with expanding a current vRealize Log Insight Deployment.
What two steps will accomplish this task? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Login to the vRealize Log Insight Management UI and select Add New Node.
choices.C: Deploy another vRealize Log Insight server from the OVF.
choices.D: Deploy and install vRealize Log Insight on a new Linux virtual machine.
choices.A: Run the startup wizard and select Join Existing Deployment.

discussion.content:
The correct answer is AC.
To add a node, deploy a new Log Insight instance with OVA image and choose "Join Deployment" in the startup wizard.

questions.question_text:
A VMware vSphere Administrator is tasked with enabling Fault Tolerance (FT) on a VM but is unable to.
What is the reason that FT cannot be enabled?
questions.answer_description:
Enabling fault tolerance on a virtual machine with more that 1 vCPU using the vSphere Client fails.
You see the error:
"The Virtual Machine has x virtual CPUs and is not supported for Fault Tolerance"
Reference: https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2130553

choices.A: The VM has a VMDK that is greater than 2TB.
choices.B: The VM is configured to use Jumbo Frames.
choices.D: The VM is running an operating system that is more than 4 years old.

discussion.content:
Option A is correct
Reference: https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2058287

A is correct. DRS is network-aware in vSphere 6.5, so it now considers the network utilization of host and network usage requirements of VMs during initial placement and load balancing
https://www.vmware.com/content/dam/digitalmarketing/vmware/en/pdf/techpaper/drs-vsphere65-perf.pdf Page 6

questions.question_text: Which option was added to the load balancing calculations of DRS in vSphere 6.5?
questions.answer_description:
Memory Metric for Load Balancing: DRS uses Active memory + 25% as its primary metric when calculating memory load on a host. The Consumed memory vs active memory will cause DRS to use the consumed memory metric rather than Active. This is beneficial when memory is not over-allocated. As a side effect, the
UI show the hosts be more balanced.
Reference:
https://blogs.vmware.com/vsphere/2016/10/whats-new-in-vsphere-6-5-host-resource-management-and-operations.html

questions.question_text: What are two requirements for Guest Operating System Customizations? (Choose two.)

choices.C: VMware Tools must be installed on the virtual machine or template.
choices.D: The guest operating system being customized must be installed on a disk attached as SCSI node 0:0 in the virtual machine configuration. CD
choices.B: Microsoft Sysrep tools must be installed on the Windows VM to be cloned.
choices.A: The ESXi host that the virtual machine is running on must be version 5.5 or later.

questions.question_text:
A vSphere Administrator has been tasked with configuring Jumbo Frames and the current environment is based on vSphere Standard Switch.
Which three steps are required?

discussion.content: Correct me if I am wrong but I didn't think you can configure MTU at the port level on standard switches.

choices.A: Verify the physical switches in the environment have been properly configured.
